Body:
Is there a way to send CoAP requests, like HTTP requests, using Python. I tried below one but I got many errors.

rec = reuest.get(coap://localhost:5683/other/block)

I assume you meant `requests.get`? (from the [`requests`](http://docs.python-requests.org/en/master/) library). Be sure to edit to clarify, and include the error message you got for reference of future visitors. It isn't really relevant to the solution **this time**, but a [mcve] is always helpful to get a good answer.

You can use a library such as CoAPython to act as a CoAP client:

from coapthon.client.helperclient import HelperClient		client = HelperClient(server=('127.0.0.1'
column9:
5683)) response = client.get('other/block') client.stop()

The response is of type Response. The methods available on the response are listed in the documentation
column10:
which you must build yourself.

Since you haven't listed what you want to do with the response
column11:
you can use the documentation to find out the methods available and get the values you want.

"
